newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine crop belt ends week with rain.
newsitem.headline: Argentine crop belt ends week with rain.

text.p: Argentine crop lands are heading for a wet Saturday, traders and forecasters said Friday.
While the maize and soybean crops are doing well, there is a possibility that much more rain later in the season could cause problems with fungus outbreaks in sunflower plants, traders said.
"It's still not a problem, but it is something to watch out for," one trader told Reuters.
Crop areas in Buenos Aires and parts of Cordoba also recieved 0.2-0.6 inches (5-15 mm) of rain early Friday morning.
The government's Meteorological Service forecast warm, unstable weather, with showers or storms throughout crop areas.
Weather Services Corp said highs would range from 77-88 F (25-31), and predicted more rain for Saturday.
